ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was the greatest academic challenge I have ever undertaken. I learned how to write a long, serious paper, and how to go about trying to make a meaningful contribution to academic writing on a topic. Also, how to work slowly and steadily on a project for a long period of time. And I learned more about my topic than I previously knew about anything in the world.

This course offered the opportunity to explore a subject that I wouldn't have been able to study otherwise. I was able to direct my own project and learn about writing a long paper with my own research.
Met biweekly with advisor to discuss progress on senior essay. These meetings were supplemented by weekly meetings with the rest of the ENGL cohort.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's great! I enjoyed our meetings. They kept me on track, and it was nice to know that other students were dealing with the same thing I was. I couldn't have done it without this course.
More clarity on what the weekly lunches were supposed to entail
I think it would be better if this course were more structured and met as if it were a class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. You need a good advisor. It's a real challenge. Only do it if you're up for it.
I recommend writing a thesis because the process allows students to explore material that isn't always offered in classes. It also allows students to direct their own research and writing.
Absolutely! An independent thesis is a great way to synthesize the skills garnered during one's career in the English department.
